TopicTitle: screen goes black on new vessel launch

Articles.Content:
When I try to launch a vessel my screen goes black and every thing I do after that is a black screen. I try to start a new game and its the same story.

here is the last part of my log,

NullReferenceException

at (wrapper managed-to-native) UnityEngine.Component:get_renderer ()

at ScreenSafeUIButton.setTextureState (Int32 st) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at ScreenSafeUIButton.Unlock () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at SpaceCenterMain.unlockUI () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at SpaceCenterMain.onInputLockModified (FromToAction`2 ctrls) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at EventData`1[GameEvents+FromToAction`2[ControlTypes,ControlTypes]].Fire (FromToAction`2 data) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at InputLockManager.RemoveControlLock (System.String lockID) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at SpaceCenterMain.OnDestroy () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

(Filename: Line: -1)

Simply giving the last few lines of the log doesn't really help anyone. It would help everyone if you provided the mods you have installed and your logs as written in the stickied thread.

Edited September 21, 2014 by mythbusters844

Ok I narrowed it down to A.T.M, F.A.R, Procedural Dynamics, B9 + deps and Interstellar 0.12 + deps . all up to date

plus M.M. 2.4.4

Edited September 21, 2014 by ebookah

I've had similar problems which emerged the moment I installed interstellar. Went from zero to a very repeatable series of kraken attacks just like yours.

It seemed to happen every time I attached a 2.5m fusion reactor and generator to a b9 supercapacitor module on the launch pad. But I haven't put much effort into narrowing what EXACTLY is needed to trigger this, only saying that interstellar is very likely the culprit?

I've had similar problems which emerged the moment I installed interstellar. Went from zero to a very repeatable series of kraken attacks just like yours.

It seemed to happen every time I attached a 2.5m fusion reactor and generator to a b9 supercapacitor module on the launch pad. But I haven't put much effort into narrowing what EXACTLY is needed to trigger this, only saying that interstellar is very likely the culprit?

I'm pretty sure you are right
